page.title: 01WORCESTERSHIRE FARMING
page.content:
This is an area of farmland almost equally devoted to grass and cereals to maintain beef and dairy herds of cattle and sheep. The farms vary in size from 800 acres to smallholdings.
Hay is mostly rolled into large bales for storage, and silage into similar bales each stored in a large black plastic bag.
Many farms have ponds and occupiers are preserving them both as features and for conservation purposes. There is a small proportion of deciduous woodland and a small area between Duckswich and Cowhills farms which was formerly salt marsh.
Other minor uses of land are the rearing of riding ponies, dog and plant breeding.
